titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Sharif Dumani Collection of Punk Flyers LSC.2444
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2023.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2023 October 17.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: This record is made available under an Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication Creative Commons license.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-04-04 13:42:22 -0700.

did.unittitle: Sharif Dumani collection of punk flyers
did.abstract: Sharif Dumani is a first-generation Costa Rican/Lebanese American native of Los Angeles, an archivist with an MLIS degree from UCLA, and a multi-instrumental musician. As a musician he has played, recorded, and toured with a wide range of underground artists including Alice Bag (The Bags), Terry Graham (The Bags, Gun Club, Cramps), Jowe Head (Swell Maps, Television Personalities), Cody ChesnuTT, Silver Apples, Nick Garrie, as well as groups Exploding Flowers, Sex Stains (ex Bratmobile, Warpaint), and Classics of Love (ex Operation Ivy). The Sharif Dumani collection of punk flyers ranges in date from 1990-2000 and contains 120 flyers from shows in and around Los Angeles.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sharif Dumani collection of punk flyers (Collection 2444). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sharif Dumani is a first-generation Costa Rican/Lebanese American native of Los Angeles, an archivist with an MLIS degree from UCLA, and a multi-instrumental musician. As a musician, he has played, recorded, and toured with a wide range of underground artists including Alice Bag (The Bags), Terry Graham (The Bags, Gun Club, Cramps), Jowe Head (Swell Maps, Television Personalities), Cody ChesnuTT, Silver Apples, Nick Garrie, as well as groups Exploding Flowers, Sex Stains (ex Bratmobile, Warpaint), and Classics of Love (ex Operation Ivy). He grew up in the Southern California punk of the late-1980s, going to shows, forming bands, and performing by the early 1990s. He is still an active participant in L.A.'s underground music community, and continues to contribute to the history of punk as being a diverse pathway for connection, community, critical thinking, consciousness, and, if we're lucky, love.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 120 punk flyers for shows in and around Los Angeles in the 1990s-2000s.

Venues include the Palladium, Macondo, Whisky A Go Go, Club Dump, Hong Kong Cafe, Palace, Coconut Teaszer, Gazzarri's, Ackerman Ballroom, Olympic Auditorium, Jabberjaw, Al's Bar, CLub Lingerie, Raji's, the Balboa Theatre, Chuck Landis' Country Club, The Vault, Hollywood Grand, and the Anti-Club.

Performers include H.R., Bad Religion, the Melvins, the Muffs, Bulimia Banquet, Shonen Knife, the Weirdos, Mudhoney, Minutemen, Victims Family, Red Aunts, Imperial Butt Wizards, Lunachicks, Duchess De Sade, Spiderbaby, Flipper, Voodoo Glow Skulls, Fifteen, Lazy Cowgirls, L7, Stanford Prison Experiment, and Mary's Danish.
